newsitem.title: POLAND: Czech Union Group to buy 70 pct of Polish bank.
newsitem.headline: Czech Union Group to buy 70 pct of Polish bank.

text.p: The Czech Union Group, the biggest shareholder of Union Banka, will buy a 70 percent stake in Poland's Bank Przemyslowy SA, Przemyslowy said in a statement on Monday.

The statement said the two banks have signed an agreement under which Union Group would take Przemyslowy's new share issue of 7.5 millon shares provided it receives a necessary National Bank of Poland permit.
"After Union Banka takes the share issue the capital of Bank Przemyslowy will rise to about 60 million zlotys from the current 22.1 million," the statement said.
It did not say how much Union Group would pay for the Przemyslowy stake.
"The cooperation (between the two banks) has a partnership character and is aimed at boosting Polish-Czech trade as well as helping Czeh investment in Poland," the statement said.
"In the future it will expand to activities in Slovakia, Russia and Hungary," it said.
Bank Przemyslowy, based in the central city of Lodz, is a small private bank in which the Lodz municipality holds the biggest 17-percent stake.
